Module kivakit.data.compression
Package com.telenav.kivakit.data.compression.codecs.huffman.tree

Class Symbols<Symbol>

java.lang.Object
com.telenav.kivakit.data.compression.codecs.huffman.tree.Symbols<Symbol>
public class Symbols<Symbol> extends Object
A set of CodedSymbols, optionally including an escape symbol, that can be used to construct a HuffmanCodec.

The constructor Symbols(CountMap, Object, Minimum) takes a map of symbol frequencies, an escape symbol (which must have a frequency entry in the map) and a minimum number of times that a symbol must appear to be encoded.

Once a set of symbols has been constructed, it can be converted to a PropertyMap object with asProperties(StringConverter, Function) and saved to a file with PropertyMap.save(WritableResource). The properties can later be loaded with PropertyMap.load(Listener, Resource) and passed to load(PropertyMap, Object, StringConverter) along with the escape symbol and a converter that can convert property keys into symbols.

PropertyMap files for creating tag codecs can easily be constructed by running the CodecGeneratorApplication application which will sample the tags in a PBF file and write them to a set of properties files:

Tag Codec Symbol Sets

  • key-character.codec
  • value-character.codec
  • key-string.codec
  • value-string.codec
Author:
jonathanl (shibo)
See Also:
HuffmanCodec, PropertyMap, CountMap, StringConverter, Resource, WritableResource, CodedSymbol

    • tree

      public Tree<Symbol> tree​(com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.language.values.count.Maximum bits)
      A brute-force algorithm for building a Huffman coding tree where no code exceeds the given maximum bit length. Simply builds a tree, checks its height and if it's too tall, removes the least frequent symbol and tries again.
